issue.title: uprev mypy

repository.name: pydantic
repository.description: Data validation using Python type hints

issue.body: uprev mypy to 0.990 since mypy tests seem to be hanging on 3.11, see [this CI run](https://github.com/pydantic/pydantic/actions/runs/3418305027/jobs/5690685408).

body:
As with #14027, would it be worth adding pydantic to mypy_primer @hauntsaninja?

As with sqlalachemy, pydantic pushes python's type system fairly hard, in particular, the schema for pydantic-core, is [defined](https://github.com/pydantic/pydantic-core/blob/463ed7aa83b08c43bc699e7e5380026551e38876/pydantic_core/core_schema.py#L1102) as a recursive union of TypedDicts.
Note that when an error is present in a file, mypy will not use cache for that file.
Btw can you try `--disable-recursive-aliases`? Such big recursive types are known to be slow.
Yup, that makes a big different, time reduces to 9s.
Also, just to be sure, can you also try `--enable-recursive-aliases` on 0.982?
Takes 261s as you predicted - seems that's the problem.

OK, then this will be not easy to fix. The problem is that you have that big union of 40 items. Previously mypy didn't support recursive types, so most likely all recursive types were either plain `Any` or shallow TypedDicts with `Any`. Mypy used to give an error about this however. I guess this error was not shown because `pydantic_core` is checked as third party dependency? You can try `--no-silence-site-packages` when using `--disable-recursive-aliases`. (Btw everything on `PYTHONPATH` is considered third party, cc @JukkaL)

So now when recursive types are properly supported imagine you have a triple nested dictionary typed as `CoreSchema`. Mypy will need to try every item in the union until it finds a matching one. This will take on average 20 * 20 * 20 = 8000 type checks for a single dict. To make things worse, TypedDicts are structural, and some have overlapping keys so it may take a while to figure out that a given item doesn't actually match.

We will still try to profile this. Maybe there is some room for optimizations.

Thanks so much for the explanation.

Simple answer might be to move to pyright, which we already use to check pydantic-core and seems to do a reasonably good job (although that union found a bug in pyright too). (I don't mean this to sound hostile, mypy is amazing and I'd love to continue to use it, but I understand if this is a fundamental limitation of the library)

If it helps, all those TypedDicts have a `type` key which can (mostly) be used as a discriminator - that's how we validate pydantic-core schema using pydantic-core, see [here](https://github.com/pydantic/pydantic-core/blob/463ed7aa83b08c43bc699e7e5380026551e38876/src/validators/union.rs#L318-L361). Using that discriminator, the number of types checked could be massively reduced, but I guess that's too specific for mypy to be able to pick up on.

Btw if you fix the errors coming from `no_implicit_optional=True` the cache should became effective again. I guess even with recursive types enabled, a typical run should take just few seconds with warm cache.

ye, I thought that, but it's still not really acceptable for either CI or new contributors for mypy to take minutes.

I guess we'll have to use `--disable-recursive-aliases`.
Thanks, pydantic is already in mypy_primer :-) However, we don't currently monitor perf regressions in mypy_primer... it's a feature I've been thinking about though

issue.title: hangs on imports from pydantic v2
issue.body:
```py
from pydantic import BaseModel
```
mypy version: 1.0.0
pydantic version: 2.0.0.dev.0 (installed from github https://github.com/pydantic/pydantic/commit/ef3cc495a9c86553b62a95a6052fd9b6ebc045e9)

when running mypy with `-vvv` it gets stuck on:
```
LOG:  Processing SCC singleton (pydantic_core.core_schema) as inherently stale
```

issue.title: Improve mypy typing performance

repository.name: pydantic-core
repository.description: Core validation logic for pydantic written in rust

issue.body:
Ref: https://github.com/python/mypy/issues/14627

Trying to run mypy with pydantic `2.0.0.dev.0` hangs when trying to lint
```py
# test.py
from pydantic import BaseModel
```

The likely reason for that is the `CoreSchema` type. Mypy can't handle unions with a lot of items that well. Especially for TypedDicts, it tries to find a common base type but when there is none, checks the compatibility of each keys individually.

That's even more of an issue as there are also some recursive annotations with `CoreSchema`.

https://github.com/pydantic/pydantic-core/blob/bfb373c269ae2bfcc32c15e4f1e59f2cee30b2ac/pydantic_core/core_schema.py#L2547-L2588

https://github.com/pydantic/pydantic-core/blob/bfb373c269ae2bfcc32c15e4f1e59f2cee30b2ac/pydantic_core/core_schema.py#L1724-L1726

To improve mypy performance, I added an empty `CoreSchemaBase` TypedDict type from which all `CoreSchema` types can inherit and replaced the recursive `CoreSchema` types. With that a mypy run is back down to 15-20s.
```
time mypy --no-incremental test.py
```

issue.title: mypy tests are taking minutes (literally)

repository.name: pydantic
repository.description: Data validation using Python type hints

issue.body:
What's going on with mypy tests, they're taking an incredibly long time, see [this recent build](https://twitter.com/wes321/status/1627718493691838478).

Slow tests:

```
62.41s call     tests/mypy/test_mypy.py::test_mypy_results[pyproject-plugin-strict.toml-plugin_success.py-plugin-success-strict.txt]
59.77s call     tests/mypy/test_mypy.py::test_mypy_results[mypy-plugin-strict-no-any.ini-dataclass_no_any.py-None]
56.15s call     tests/mypy/test_mypy.py::test_mypy_results[pyproject-default.toml-success.py-None]
54.15s call     tests/mypy/test_mypy.py::test_mypy_results[mypy-plugin-strict.ini-plugin_success.py-plugin-success-strict.txt]
51.63s call     tests/mypy/test_mypy.py::test_mypy_results[mypy-default.ini-success.py-None]
51.50s call     tests/mypy/test_mypy.py::test_mypy_results[pyproject-plugin.toml-plugin_success.py-None]
49.02s call     tests/mypy/test_mypy.py::test_mypy_results[mypy-plugin.ini-plugin_success.py-None]
1.41s call     tests/mypy/test_mypy.py::test_mypy_results[pyproject-default.toml-fail4.py-fail4.txt]
1.31s call     tests/mypy/test_mypy.py::test_mypy_results[mypy-plugin-strict.ini-plugin_fail_baseConfig.py-plugin-fail-strict-baseConfig.txt]
0.67s call     tests/mypy/test_mypy.py::test_mypy_results[pyproject-default.toml-fail3.py-fail3.txt]
```

This wasn't the case until a recent upgrade of mypy.

Any suggestions on how to fix it?

issue.title: feature: Support Pydantic V2

repository.name: immoney
repository.description: A better standard for representing money in Python.

issue.body:
Closes #20.


<details>
<summary>Todo</summary>

- [x] Pydantic V2 runs very slow on mypy. https://github.com/pydantic/pydantic/issues/5083, https://github.com/python/mypy/issues/14034
- [x] Parameterize OverDraft and SubunitFraction over currency.
- [x] Test generated schema.
- [x] Address fixmes.

</details>

body:
I did some testing and came up with a self-contained example that may be helpful.

It seems that both the size of the union and how many times `SchemaXX()` gets called both matter. Using non-overlapping keys (e.g. `type_99`) doesn't seem to matter. Removing the recursive references does indeed improve things.

<details>
<summary>Long code block</summary>


```python
from typing import Union
from typing_extensions import TypedDict, Literal, NotRequired

    type: Literal['schema-0']
    schema: NotRequired['Schema']
```

</details>

Any update on this, or generally update on mypy performance?

We're at the point where we're going to have to litter pydantic's docs with messages discouraging use of mypy, which seems really sad.

As of today running mypy `mypy 1.1.1 (compiled: yes)` on the following code

```py
from pydantic import BaseModel

class MyModel(BaseModel):
    x: int
```
* `mypy example.py` runs indefinitely, definitely for hours
* `mypy example.py --disable-recursive-aliases` takes 90s on my i7 desktop with no cache

@sobolevn @AlexWaygood @JukkaL Sorry to push, but this is a very unfortunate situation, is there anything you could do to help?

Even if you had a hack to automatically ignore the `pydantic_core` package (e.g. treat it like it has no `py.typed` file) while still allowing us run mypy with it included in CI, that would help a lot until the performance issues could be fixed.

To be clear, the problem is [this](https://github.com/pydantic/pydantic-core/blob/main/pydantic_core/core_schema.py) which is very important to pydantic, but kills mypy.
